# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

In Julia, you can define your function like this:

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime; bump::Int = 3)
    if typeof(dt) == Date
        throw(ArgumentError("Function only works with DateTime types."))
    end
    
    return dt + Hour(bump)
end
```
This function takes a `DateTime` object as input and returns the same date time but increased by `bump` hours. If an incorrect type is passed (like just a `Date`), it throws an error.
